HomeWiki:
Project Description

In this project we aim to create a simple client application, adapting base features of previous source control – Visual Source Safe 6.0 (VSS) to the Team Foundation System 2008 (TFS) environment.

The concept of VTFC similar to VSS: you can synchronize TFS documents to your local workplace, using get latest version feature whereby you get the complete list of change sets and you can accept or discard one-by-one.

If you develop in TFS 2008 environment or you prefer flat than thin architecture, you can use this tool for managing source controlled documents.

Architecture
This simple block diagram below demonstrates simplified architecture of VTFC.



We used the WSS 3.0 web services for integrating VTFC and TFS.

WSS 3.0 web service API details can be found here: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd878586(v=office.12).aspx

Architecture pattern follows the MVC design pattern and contains 6 modules (*.csproj) and the setup project.

Application was implemented using .NET 3.5 C# in Visual Studio 2010 development environment.

Features 

  • Connect/disconnect to TFS
  • Get latest version
  • Create/delete document library
  • Create/delete folder
  • Add items (batch update)
  • Update/Edit/Check out/Check in/Undo pending changes/Rename/Delete documents
  • Apply common features of the out of source controlled files
  • Event logging (Windows event log)
  • Message and command logging (Output part)
